creator: yashdeep@gmail.com
text:
I am trying to access a file which is on a mapped drive. The drive is on the 
same machine which has Tomcat, but is mapped over the network as if it is an 
external drive. This fails with a FileNotFound exception.
Even if the drive is created with a subst command, to point to a local share, 
it fails with the same error.
This occurs only with Windows 2003 server, Windows 2000 server works fine with 
the same configuration.
The Java version being used is 1.4.2_10
This is the stack trace I get.

java.io.FileNotFoundException: H:\22244.pdf (The system cannot find the path 
specified)

org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.processConnectio

This is not a bug, I think.
Please consult the users list for assistance.

A starting point for you: Tomcat is run as local System account, which
has no access to network drives at all.
